dialog.speechTarget: 다희야, 왜 그래? 어디 아파? 안색이 안 좋은데?
dialog.speechNative: Da-hee. What’s wrong? Are you sick? You don’t look well.

dialog.speechTarget: 응? 어... 그냥 몸이 좀 안 좋네.
dialog.speechNative: Huh? Yeah... I just don’t feel well.

dialog.speechTarget: 왜? 감기 걸렸어? 아님 뭐 잘못 먹었어?
dialog.speechNative: Why? Have you caught a cold? Or did you eat something bad?

dialog.speechTarget: 아니. 뭐 잘못 먹은 건 아니고. 어제부터 기운이 없고 몸이 으슬으슬 떨리더니 계속 더 심해지네.
dialog.speechNative: No, I didn’t eat anything bad. I haven’t had any energy since yesterday. I started feeling chilly, and it’s getting worse and worse.

dialog.speechTarget: 감기네 감기. 몸살감기 걸렸나 보다.
dialog.speechNative: It’s a cold. I think you caught a cold and now your body aches.

dialog.speechTarget: 응. 그런 것 같아.
dialog.speechNative: Yeah, I think so.

dialog.speechTarget: 요즘 독감이 유행이더라. 세경이도 감기 걸렸다고 오늘 학교 안 왔어.
dialog.speechNative: I heard that the flu is going around these days. Se-gyeong also didn’t come to school today because she caught a cold.

dialog.speechTarget: 아, 그래?
dialog.speechNative: Oh, really?

dialog.speechTarget: 응. 심하게 걸렸나 봐. 오늘 새벽부터 응급실 갔다 왔다더라.
dialog.speechNative: Yeah, I guess she caught a really bad one. I heard that she went to the emergency room early in the morning today.

dialog.speechTarget: 정말?
dialog.speechNative: Really?

dialog.speechTarget: 응. 너는 약은 먹었어?
dialog.speechNative: Yeah. Did you take some medicine?

dialog.speechTarget: 응, 약 먹었어.
dialog.speechNative: Yeah, I took some medicine.

dialog.speechTarget: 너도 병원 가 봐야 되는 거 아냐?
dialog.speechNative: Shouldn't you go see a doctor too?

dialog.speechTarget: 아냐. 그 정돈 아니야. 다음 주 시험이라서 오늘 수업 빠지면 안 돼.
dialog.speechNative: No, it’s not that bad. The exam is next week, so I can’t skip classes today.

dialog.speechTarget: 으이구. 내가 필기해서 보여 줄게. 양호실이라도 가서 좀 쉬고 와.
dialog.speechNative: Come on. I will take some notes and show them to you. At least go to the nurse’s room and get some rest.

dialog.speechTarget: 아냐, 괜찮아. 말이라도 고맙다.
dialog.speechNative: No, I’m good. Thanks for the offer though.

dialog.speechTarget: 그래, 그럼. 몸 더 안 좋아지면 꼭 병원 가 봐.
dialog.speechNative: Okay, then. If you feel worse, make sure you go to the hospital.

dialog.speechTarget: 알겠어. 고마워.
dialog.speechNative: I got it. Thank you.

dialog.speechTarget: 응.
dialog.speechNative: Okay.

dialog.speechTarget: 김다희. 너 왜 그래? 어디 아파?
dialog.speechNative: Da-hee, what’s wrong? Are you sick?

dialog.speechTarget: 아... 괜찮아요.
dialog.speechNative: Ah... I’m alright.

dialog.speechTarget: 괜찮기는. 너 머리가 불덩이야. 금방 쓰러질 것 같아.
dialog.speechNative: You’re not alright. Your head is on fire. It looks like you’re about to faint.

dialog.speechTarget: 아... 저 감기에 좀 걸려서... 선생님, 저 양호실에 좀 갔다 올게요.
dialog.speechNative: Ah... I caught a cold... Let me go visit the nurse’s office.

dialog.speechTarget: 그래, 얼른 다녀와. 양호 선생님이 조퇴하라고 하시면 바로 조퇴하고 병원 가.
dialog.speechNative: Okay. Hurry up. If the nurse tells you to leave early, take the rest of the day off and go to the hospital quickly.

dialog.speechTarget: 네. 알겠습니다. 다녀올게요.
dialog.speechNative: Okay. I understand. See you.

vocabulary.nativeLanguageText: to be omitted, to not be included
to be okay, to be alright
to be thankful, to be grateful

patterns.patternNative: (SUBJECT) am/is/are getting more and more ADJECTIVE.

exercises.exercise: I’m getting more and more curious. (to be curious = 궁금하다)
It’s getting bigger and bigger. (to be bigger = 더 크다)

appliedPatterns.patternNote: Even without the word 더, which means “more”, the sentence will have the same meaning here.
-져 is a more neutral ending than -지네, which shows one’s observation.

patterns.patternNative: I can’t VERB. / I shouldn’t VERB.

exercises.exercise: I can’t get drunk today. (to get drunk = 취하다, today = 오늘)
I shouldn’t exercise today. (to exercise = 운동하다, today = 오늘)

patterns.patternNative: It looks like (SUBJECT) is about to VERB.
patterns.exampleSentenceNative: It looks like you’re about to faint.

exercises.exercise: It looks like we’re about to get a call. (to get a call = 전화 오다)
It looks like they’re about to depart. (to depart = 출발하다)

appliedPatterns.patternNativeText: It looks like you’re about to faint.
appliedPatterns.patternNote: Even though 막 can mean many things, in this context it means “soon” or “anytime now”.

appliedPatterns.patternNativeText: It looks like you will faint soon.
